reviewText: Kathy Griffin is the only celebrity (albeit a "D List" celebrity) who doesn't seem to know about that little unspoken rule that all celebrities are expected to live by.  You know what I'm talking about, right?  There's this rule somewhere when you sign that celebrity contract which states that you aren't allowed to talk about the mean, stupid, rude, clueless, carpy and/or tasteless things that other celebs do off-camera.  Not only has Kathy Griffin forgotten that taboo, she's made a career out of breaking it - and yes Kathy, we do love you for it!Allegedly is Griffin's latest installment in her ongoing mission to expose the truth about the beautiful people who normally have complete control over their carefully constructed public images.  OTOH here's Kathy:  blunt, open and the opposite of all things pretentious.  She has that way about her that suggests that you're meeting your best friend for lunch and a lot of dishing up on gossip.  Here is about one hour of taking down many sacred cows;  Gwyneth Paltrow, Barbara Walters, Eminem, Salma Hayek, and more.  She talks about her USO tour with other D lists and her VH1 Fashion Award encounters.  Her impersonations are spot-on funny.  We learn about behind sweat difficulties, which are surprisingly funny coming from Kathy.  A direct quote from my husband:  "She's really very base; I like her!"Although I laughed often and well while watching Allegedly, I couldn't give a full five star rating because it seemed that a few things were off with Kathy on the night that this stand-up routine was filmed.  When I remembered her "D List" special from a few years ago as shown on Comedy Central I couldn't help but compare how relaxed and natural she seemed then compared to now; hurried, more on edge and a little angrier.  She seemed to be having less fun with her material, and so did I.  Nonetheless this is all great stuff and I strongly recommend Allegedly for any fans of hers and for anybody who's interested in a little glimpse into the goings-on of backstage life in Hollywood.-Andrea, aka Merribelle
summary: Oh Kathy that is *so* appropriate!  We could use more of you

reviewText: I think with Kathy Griffin, you need to have a slightly "different" sense of humor.  Her joke-telling is a tad left of standard.  Yet, they are funny.  She has charisma enough to put you at ease so you feel like you and her are best friends.  I think that's part of her charm and part of the reason she is so funny.  Now, I don't fall into either of her main categories, I'm a straight male, (you really need to have listened to her comedy to truly appreciate the first part of this comment) but I find her down right hilarious.  She pokes fun at the quirks of the "A-list" celebrities she talks about.  Her whole bit on Paris Hilton is freaking hilarious.  She's non-apologetic about her jokes and who she talks about.  There aren't too many people she won't talk about for the laugh.  And if you take her too seriously about it, that's your problem.  The bonus features on this are good as well.  This DVD reminds me of a celebrity rag filtered through, say, Sam Kinison.  Her mouth isn't quite as bad as Kinison's, but if you aren't into "colorful" language, don't buy this.  Now, I'm all for free speech, I don't think we should have to be censored because a few people don't like it, but I mention this so that those who don't like or are truly and honestly offended by such language don't buy this and complain later that "I didn't know she talked like this!  This is unbearable!"  I mean, it isn't like every other word is a curse word, but there is a smattering.  So be warned.  But, if you are looking at this DVD, you are probably pretty familiar with the Kathy.  So sit back, relax, and laugh.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen Kathy Griffin reporting from the red carpet on some E! programme once (could have been at the 2004 Oscars?)[No , it wasnt the VH1 Fashion Awards :-)]. I also saw her on the Celebrity Mole DVD I bought and liked her and her sense of humour on both occasions. Thus I took the plunge and ordered her standup show ALLEGEDLY, and boy, did I laugh!!! It's a wonderfully funny show, and feels more like a hilarious gossip fest than a stand-up show. Granted, she says "so anyway" too many times, but I guess that adds to the vibe of her style. I will watch this a couple of times and show it to a lot of people as this is laugh out loud funny. And I was genuinely disappointed when she said goodbye. I was ready for at least another 30 minutes!!

reviewText: This is hands down Kathy Griffin's best special. Her geniuness is endearing and her honesty is hilarious. She pokes fun at everyone in Hollywood including herself. Her style of story telling will have you rolling from the get go.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Making fun of Celebrities is Kathy's thing. I love how she opens the show "I don't have time to be positive" she continues on to poke fun at everyone from the F-list (like, Debbie Gibson) up to A-Listers  (like Gweneth Paltrow). This is not Kathy's best performance and you can tell she's really scatter brained, she even forgets part of her show and has to ask her husband for help so she can remember. But like a trooper she keeps on going. If you like Kathy Griffin you'd really enjoy this DVD. I did. I'd love to have some of her other stuff on DVD though, more recent things. I don't know what to do now that Ellen isn't doing Stand Up anymore... Margaret Cho is too political to be funny, Paula Poundstone seems to be trying to make a comeback, Ellen's doing daytime TV.. so Kathy is pretty much the only funny lady out there right now.. So lets give her all the support we can!! Love Kathy, Love her Bad Attitude.. and the thing is, I'm sure she exaggerates a little in her stories for comedic effect, as anyone would, but I'm certain that everything she tells us is real... really happened. When she talks about Red Carpet stuff, you can go back and watch it (if you record it) and see that kind of stuff was really going on. Which makes it all the more funnier to know all she's doing is telling you what happened when she happened to be somewhere.  I dont' understand why celebrities are so afraid of her. I know if I were an A-Lister she'd be the first person I'd want to talk to on the red-carpet.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love all of Kathy's specials. She is the queen of insider dish. Using her D-list celebrity, she lets us in on all the backstage shenanigans that we e and f-listers will never get access to. If you're not familiar with her, Kathy is a comedian who finds herself frequently at hollywood functions and bumping in to all sorts of big stars. They do all sorts of outrageous things, and surely a lot of mundane things as well, but Kathy's perspective and unique brand of storytelling makes the situations really shine. She often pokes fun at stars and makes them look petty or oblivious, but you can also tell that she loves what she does and the people she exposes. It's campy, hilarious, and I'm so glad she's still out there doing what she does.

reviewText: Kathy Griffin is without doubt one of the best stand-up comedians of all time. She's hilarious! Her observations on life, politics and celebrity culture in particular are always dead on, witty and ultimately thought-provoking. She is unafraid to share her experiences no matter who she offends in the process and it is this honesty that makes her so funny. Allegedly is one of her many specials and as they are all excellent, I cannot choose a favourite. However, needless to say, if you love Kathy or comedy in general, you will not be disappointed! You'll be quoting her as soon as the show is over, if not during it! She is awesome!

reviewText: Tired of all the pretentiousness of celebritism--a disease that strikes down the minds of the rich and famous in the public eye?  Then settle in for a great night of comedy and take on ALLEGEDLY.  Thank God for Kathy Griffin!  She pokes holes...no...blows wide open the self-absorbed craziness of the Hollywood few while also remaining a fan of it.  Kathy's diatribes are always funny and what's more, they are always on target.  Who is Barbara Walters to take herself so seriously and why should we allow Donna Karan to act as if she's better than everyone else?  People in the entertainment business really are desperate for attention--right,Britney and Kevin? Kathy's DVD is a laugh-a-minute riot that will leave you wanting more, which is why you need to RUN and see her when she's in your town.  I just saw her at the DC IMPROV and she was amazing. Her commentary on what's wrong with celebrities never gets old and so if you're the kind of famous person (Cruise, Holmes, an obviously gay IDOLized reality show host, a PAYLESS DIVA from THE VIEW, or a cracky diva who's married to a washed out rap star who can't remember the names of his own children) who thinks they're above it all, have no fear, Kathy will be there to take you down!  And fortunately, everyone will be laughing at the time!  I can hardly wait to see her next DVD!!!
summary: The Funniest Woman on the Planet Today!

reviewText: In a world where very few female stand up comedians make their own paths, there are still those few who shine like bright light bulbs.  Those rare exceptions include: the very famous Ellen DeGeneres, Kathleen Madigan, Tammy Pescatelli, and the star of this DVD, Kathy Griffin.I honestly was worried I wouldn't like it when I first read on the box that basicly she was going to insult celeberties for about an hour and a half.  But this was just so fun to watch.  I mean not only did you get to hear how the celebs really act off camera, you get to hear it in a comical aspect that was delivered perfectly by the wonderful graces of Kathy.  She covered a lot in her 1 hour and 30 minutes of viewing time: from her VH1 Fashion Awards red carpet nightmare, to Book Shields' crazy wedding, to her battle on the set of The View with Barbara Walters, all the way to her USO tour to entertain the troops.This DVD is uncensored and therefor not meant as a holliday gift for all the little ones to hear unless you approve of your kids watching this.  She hides nothing; she goes full on hardcore with any celeb, which makes for a fun watch and lots of laughs.

reviewText: Kathy Griffin's Life is D-list - only according to her. To her fans, she is A -list all the way, and this DVD  proves it! 'Allegedly' is Kathy at her uncensored, straight-up, no-holds-barred, un-bleeped best. This a stand-up routine from 2004 that is just as hysterical today, and it's definately something you'll watch over and over. Whether she's dishing on Brooke Sheild's mom, Gwyneth, Barbara Walters and the ladies of The View or any other random celebrity in Hollywood, Kathy shoots straight from the hip, and takes aim at everyone! No one is safe from her razor sharp wit or her acid tongue...even if it is only 'allegedly' true! This lady is amazing to watch onstage. You can almost see her mind racing from one hot topic to another, and she'll make you laugh so hard, your sides will hurt. When was the last time that happened? Pick this one up NOW, and enjoy it. You won't regret it.
summary: This is Kathy AT HER UNCENSORED BEST !

reviewText: OK, if you've ever been a fan of Margaret Cho (before she got cracked out and scary-political) then Kathy Griffin will absolutely crack you up.She's equally self-deprecating (especially on her D-list celebrity status) and vicious towards bigger celebrities (Barbara Walters, Gwyneth Paltrow, Douglas/Zeta-Jones) and just fully, fully funny.I always thought she was the best part of Suddenly Susan and that her sarcastic sense of humor was what kept that show on as long as it was.. it certainly wasn't Brooke Shields!Definitely not appropriate for the kids, but I showed this at a party recently and I think most of the people ended up going out and buying it for their own collection.  Go Kathy!PS - Bravo just optioned 6 episodes of "The D-List" so hopefully she'll be back on TV soon, too!

reviewText: Potty mouth? Yeah. Hollywood trasher? Totally. Pop cultureenthusiast? For sure. And I love every minute of her routine.This is a great disc not only for the stand up, but for the homemovies Kathy shares with us of her trip to the Middle East. Ihad the great pleasure of seeing her live last year, and shewas fantastic. Listening to her on stage was like being amongfriends sharing raw, juicy gossip. Kathy shoots straight fromthe hip in terms of Hollywood and its insanity, which is why Ilove her. Those people need to be taken down a few notchesand Kathy Griffin is the only one willing to expose their reality.As for coming up with new material, why? If it ain't broke, don'tfix it. A lot of the people who have a problem with her humorprobably have a problem with strong-willed, opinionated womento begin with. As far as I'm concerned, she can trash Hollywood'til the cows come home. Stay on the D-list, Kathy! Those of uswho know the Hollywood Emperor is buck naked need youthere to keep making us laugh!

reviewText: Highly recommended to anyone who likes a good, politically incorrect laugh, ALLEGEDLY is one of the funniest comedy concert performances ever recorded.  Starring Hollywood bad girl Griffin, this 90 minute DVD is like a slow motion explosion, where time is suspended as the viewer rubbernecks at the spectacle of an ambitious comedian, torching celebrities, from Barbara Walters and Gwyneth Paltrow to Larry King and Vogue magazine's Anna Wintour.Periodically scolding herself with an "Oh Kathy that was inappropriate," when she gone way way way beyond acceptable conversation, Griffin in this 2004 DVD, is like a pyro with tourettes, who ignites the audience in nervous wet-your-pants laughter as she skewers Afgan warlords, reveals her love of wiggers and fear of Justin Timberlake who she says is now so far beyond black that he's now "nubian."Perhaps the funniest and most disturbing bit in ALLEGEDLY is Griffin's tale of attending Brooke Shields wedding.  While beyond hilarious, if any of what Griffin says is true, that has to have been one of the most outrageous weddings everThough they say this DVD is only 90 minutes long, it feels like it lasts for hours.  And not because it is slow and boring.  Far from it.  It's hilarious and no one else on earth could ever pack so many jokes, stories and observations into a mere hour and a half.  Plus ALLEGEDLY features a short, but fun home movie of Kathy's USO trip to Afganistan.  At this point I cannot remember how I found it, but ALLEGEDLY also features an extra chapter about Jillian Barberi that is not listed in the main menu.- Regina McMenamin
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you want to laugh hard and loud, check out Kathy Griffin's uncensored live concert ALLEGEDLY (Anchor Bay).The D-List Diva offers her hilarious, irreverent and profane take on her stint as red carpet host at the VH1 Awards, her USO tour to Afghanistan, Brooke Shields' wedding and an unsettling encounter with Barbara Walters on live TV.In concert, Griffin empties herself of ego and pretense. She is self deprecating and fearless in her revelations and she has a wicked gift for sharing her perversely twisted delight in the bizarre, pompous and even dangerous behaviour of her fellow humans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: (This review was originally posted on August 25, 2005)I just watched this DVD last night and I can't remember laughing this much in quite a while.Until now, I pretty much only knew Kathy Griffin from "Suddenly Susan", where she stole the show from Brooke Shields, and from her interviews about her face job(s) on tabloid shows.  I had no idea how foul-mouthed she was and, while expecting this show to be funny, I never thought she was this dirty!  This is not something you'll want to watch with the kids around...This DVD will mostly appeal to people interested in A-list celebrities and equipped with a good sense of sarcasm.  Don't expect any politically correct stuff on this disc.  From Gwyneth Paltrow to Tommy Lee to Barbara Walters, no one escapes her negativity!Let's hope for more Kathy Griffin shows to be released on DVD in the near future and that a cure for "flop sweat" is found!August 26, 2006: Is it just me or has a Kathy Griffin hater rated everyone's reviews negatively?
